armorEffects.medium: Monsters with Medium Armor ignore all damage modifiers from stats and other effects, taking damage from the sum of the dice only.
armorEffects.heavy: Monsters with Heavy Armor ignore damage modifiers and take half the sum of the dice (rounding up).

conditionDescriptions.blinded: Can't see. Attacks against you have advantage, and your attacks have disadvantage.
conditionDescriptions.charged: Whenever you take lightning damage you are Charged for 1 minute.
conditionDescriptions.charmed: Sees the charmer as an ally. Charmer has advantage on social interactions with you.
conditionDescriptions.concentration: Can only Concentrate on 1 thing at a time. DC 10 STR save when crit or lose concentration.
conditionDescriptions.dazed:
Heroes: lose 1 action.

Monsters: can perform one less action on their next turn.
conditionDescriptions.dead: You die when you have taken 6 Wounds (unless you have an ability that changes this number). There are ways to revive a hero who has died, but they are rare and often come at a very steep cost.
conditionDescriptions.despair: Disadvantage on the next attack you make in this encounter.
conditionDescriptions.distracted: A target is distracted if it is adjacent to or Taunted by an ally, or if it cannot see you.
conditionDescriptions.dying: At 0HP. Taking damage while dying causes 2 Wounds, a crit causes 3 instead.
conditionDescriptions.frightened: Disadvantage on rolls when source of fear is nearby; speed halved when moving closer to it.
conditionDescriptions.grappled: Cannot move. Attacks against you have advantage.
conditionDescriptions.hampered: Any creature with their actions or movement reduce (e.g. Dazed, Grappled, Prone, Difficult Terrain).
conditionDescriptions.incapacitated: Can't do anything. Attacks against you have advantage, and melee attacks that hit, crit.
conditionDescriptions.invisible: Cannot be seen. Your attacks have advantage, and attacks against you have disadvantage.
conditionDescriptions.paralyzed: Incapacitated. Can’t do anything. Attacks against you have advantage, and melee attacks that hit, crit.
conditionDescriptions.petrified: Incapacitated. You have all the benefits and drawbacks of being a rock! Immune to most damage except from large explosions, picks, or similar tools.
conditionDescriptions.prone: Movement costs twice as much, and disadvantage on attacks. Melee attacks against you have advantage; Ranged have disadvantage. Spend 3 spaces of your Speed to stand up.
conditionDescriptions.restrained: Cannot move. Attacks against you have advantage.
conditionDescriptions.riding: You move with the creature you are riding. Any attacks that miss you, strike them.
conditionDescriptions.silenced: Cannot cast spells or use other abilities that require speaking (e.g. Commander's Orders).
conditionDescriptions.smoldering: Some fire spells can inflict the Smoldering condition and gain additional destructive effects against Smoldering enemies.
conditionDescriptions.stunned: Incapacitated. Can’t do anything. Attacks against you have advantage, and melee attacks that hit, crit.
conditionDescriptions.taunted: Disadvantage on attacks except against the most recent taunter.
conditionDescriptions.unconscious: Incapacitated. Can’t do anything. Attacks against you have advantage, and melee attacks that hit, crit.
conditionDescriptions.wounded: Has any Wounds (typically 6 Wounds and a hero is dead).

languageHints.draconic: Typically spoken by Dragons, Dragonkin, and Kobolds.
languageHints.dwarvish: Typically spoken by Dwarves, Gnomes, and Giants.
languageHints.elvish: Typically spoken by Elves, Fey, and Sylvan.
languageHints.goblin: Typically spoken by Goblins and Orcs.
languageHints.primordial: Spoken by Elementals and Ancient Beings.

hints.skillPointAssignment: You may assign a single skill point to a skill of your choice. In addition, you may transfer one of your assigned skill points to another skill of your choice.
hints.characterCreationSkillPointAssignment: You can now assign 4 skills points to increase the modifiers for your skills.

levelUpDialog.skillPointsOverMax: One or more skills would exceed the 12 point cap. Please reallocate skill points before submitting.
levelUpDialog.skillPointsOverMaxTooltip: A skill would exceed the 12 point cap

skillPointAssignment.onlyOneNewPointAndOneTransferAllowed: Only 1 new point and 1 transfer are allowed per level-up.
skillPointAssignment.reduceAnotherSkillFirstToAddSkillPoint: Reduce another skill first to add a skill point.
skillPointAssignment.limitReached: Limit reached: Only 1 new point and 1 transfer are allowed per level-up.

creatureFeatures.actionSequence: After each hero's turn, choose one.

multiclassing.name: Allow Multiclassing
multiclassing.hint: Enables the optional multiclass rule allowing heroes to take levels in different classes when leveling up.

largeGroups.name: Limit Actions for Large Groups
largeGroups.hint: Sets each hero's actions to 2 when the group size exceeds 6.

fastResting.name: Enable Fast Resting
fastResting.hint: Safe Rests fully heal all Wounds for a faster-paced, heroic game.

criticalHealing.name: Enable Critical Healing
criticalHealing.hint: Treats healing rolls like attacks — max rolls explode, ones fail.

thrownPotions.name: Enable Thrown Potions
thrownPotions.hint: Allows throwing potions like ranged attacks (Range 8, half effect).

suckerPunch.name: Enable Sucker Punch Rule
suckerPunch.hint: Standing from Prone provokes opportunity attacks.

inspiration.name: Enable Inspiration
inspiration.hint: Grants rerolls for memorable or role-played moments.

keyStatSwap.name: Allow Key Stat Swapping
keyStatSwap.hint: Enables swapping primary/secondary stats for class flexibility.

complexCharacters.name: Allow Complex Characters
complexCharacters.hint: Permits heroes to pick 2 backgrounds and/or ancestry bonuses.

customWeaponDice.name: Enable Custom Weapon Dice
customWeaponDice.hint: Allows alternative dice combinations that total equivalent sizes.

measurementSystem.name: Measurement Style
measurementSystem.hint: Choose how range and distance are measured in the game.

grittyDying.name: Gritty Dying Variant
grittyDying.hint: Optional lethality variant: reduce the max number of Wounds heroes can sustain.

grittyDyingPenalty.name: Wounds Penalty
grittyDyingPenalty.hint: Each Wound imposes a cumulative –1 penalty to specified rolls.

conditionHUD.name: Condition HUD
conditionHUD.hint: Enables a quick-access HUD to apply Nimble conditions.

reactionPrompts.name: Reaction Prompts
reactionPrompts.hint: Displays contextual buttons for Defend, Interpose, Help, and Opportunity Attacks.

assessHelper.name: Assess Action Helper
assessHelper.hint: Adds DC 12 Assess automation with question/advantage prompts.

showSkillTooltips.name: Show Skill Tooltips
showSkillTooltips.hint: Displays skill explanations when hovering over skill names.

showBoons.name: Show Lodging Boons
showBoons.hint: Shows minor/major lodging boons in character sheets and rest dialogs.

debugLogs.name: Enable Debug Logging
debugLogs.hint: Outputs rule processing and condition data to the console.

languageSet.name: Available Languages
languageSet.hint: Determines languages selectable in character creation.
